Getting Started
Basic Menu Navigation
These cover the basics of Android navigation through Talkback
Controlling Reading
These cover the gestures and actions to perform to change the read settings of Talkback
Interacting with Media
These cover the gestures and action to interact with media
Advanced Menu Navigation
These cover the gestures and actions to perform navigation in an advance menu
Typing Lesson
These cover the gestures and actions to use a virtual keyboard on your phone
Typing Using Braille Keyboard
These cover the gestures and actions to use the braille keyboard on your phone
External Apps
These provide real world experience by having you jump to other applications
You have completed the challenge. Find and select the back button to return to the main menu.

inspectToy
Tennis Ball
Tennis Racquet

Welcome to Lesson 2\'s challenge. In challenges, you\'ll be presented with practical scenarios to demonstrate your new learnt skills. In this challenge, you\'ll be presented with a store. To complete the lesson, add the tennis ball and the tennis racquet to your watchlist. The tennis ball has a price of $5, and the tennis racquet has a price of $180. You may now start.
Rating: %1$d stars

Welcome to Lesson 3\'s challenge. In this challenge you will be presented with a number of different page elements which you will need to navigate through. To complete the challenge, you must navigate through all page elements using the specified reading controls until you reach the complete challenge button.
Easy Baking Recipes
Cookies
This scrumptious and chewy chocolate-chip cookie recipe is guaranteed to satisfy your sweet tooth!

In this challenge, you\'ll be presented an article with an embedded video already playing. To complete the challenge, pause the video, and return its slider to the beginning of the video, then replay it. You may now start.
Welcome to Lesson 5\'s challenge. In this challenges, you\'ll be ask to perform a sequence of tasks.
Now, go to your home screen and back to this app to find the next task.
Welcome back. Now a new message is sent from Billy, open the notification to find it.
Billy\'s message
Hello I am Billy, you can complete this challenge by double tap this message from the notification. Then you will be sent to the main menu.
lesson5ChallengePart2
Talkback tutorial
Notification description
Welcome to Lesson 6\'s challenge. In this challenge, you\'ll be asked to send a message to your friend, Bob, in a chat room. Now let\'s get started
To finish this challenge send a message to Bob and include his name. Then find the back button to exit the challenge
bob
Welcome. In your first lesson, you will learn to move forwards and backwards between menu items, as well as interact with them. Double tap to continue.
lesson1part2
lesson1part3

To start, you will learn to navigate back and forth between elements on the screen. To go to the next element, swipe right. To go to the previous element, swipe left. Elements will always speak a description of itself. When you are ready to move on, double tap.
You have interacted with a menu item. Find the button, then double tap to finish the lesson.
You have completed the lesson. Sending you to the main menu.

You will now learn to interact with elements on the screen. To interact with an element, double tap when you have selected it. For this activity, explore the elements on the screen until you reach the button. To tap the button and finish the lesson, double tap.

In this module, you will learn how to add a space using the braille keyboard. Ensure the braille keyboard is active and set to default. If you are unsure how to do this, refer to a previous module. To begin, type the letter a in braille and then submit the text. To submit, use a two finger swipe up gesture. Note, the braille keyboard must be in the correct orientation for this gesture to work correctly.
Incorrect letter submitted. Try again.
Great job. You correctly typed in a space.
Now, try to shift to a new line and submit using the same two finger swipe up gesture.
Great job. You correctly moved to a new line. You have completed this module. Sending you back to the lesson screen.
Incorrect input submitted. Try again.

There are reading and navigation modes. Reading modes help you read in a granular way, such as by words, paragraphs, or characters. Navigation modes help you move around more efficiently, such as by jumping from button to button.
This module covers how to adjust TalkBack\'s reading controls, which lets us make TalkBack read and navigate in different ways. When you change modes, TalkBack will speak the mode you switched to.
To change your mode, swipe up and down in one motion. Try to go through all of the options before moving on.
You can go backwards through the list. Swipe down then up in one motion to go through the list in the opposite direction.
Modes can also be switched by swiping with three fingers horizontally either to the left or to the right. Try going through the list with three finger swipes in both directions before moving on.
That\'s all there is to changing modes. The rest of this lesson covers how to use these modes. Activate the button below to finish this module.
adjustSliderModulePart2

Welcome.In this module, you will learn how to increase and decrease slider values. A slider is a track that contains values between a minimum and a maximum. Sliders are often used to adjust times. For example. song times or video times. You can also adjust this phones volume using a slider. To start you will try increasing a sliders value. To increase a slider swipe up. To continue increase the slider value to 100%
Well done! Now you will try decreasing the sliders value. To decrease a slider swipe down. To continue set the slider value to 50%
Well done! You now know how to adjust a slider by swiping up or down. You will now be taken to the next part of this module

Welcome to the next part of the module. Another way of adjusting sliders is to double tap then drag. To start you will try increasing the sliders value. To increase a slider double tap and hold the slider then drag right. To continue increase the slider value to 100%. Note that you will have to use explore by touch to find the slider.
Now you will try decreasing the sliders value. To decrease a slider double tap and hold then drag left. To continue decrease the slider value to 0%.
Well done! now you know how to adjust sliders by dragging. This gesture can be used for any sliders, but will be most useful for adjusting video and song times.

In this module, you will apply what you have learnt from the previous lessons to use the simple calculator app. You will be given a simple calculation task to work on. Unless you complete this task successfully, we will let you retry as many times.
You have successfully completed this module. We have sent you back to the talkback module. please proceed to finish module.
Sending you back to the main module page

In this task, please provide the correct calculation for 9 × 5 to get the result 45. As a quick hint for this task, please use the knowledge, in "explore menu by scroll" lesson that you have already learned previously, to find the correct buttons.
Calculator is not installed. Please install it and reopen this module.

In this module, you will learn how to delete letters and words using the braille keyboard. Ensure the braille keyboard is active and set to default. If you are unsure how to do this, refer to a previous module. To begin, type the letter a in braille and then submit the text. To submit, use a two finger swipe up gesture. Note, the braille keyboard must be in the correct orientation for this gesture to work correctly. Finally, there is just one letter in the text field below L. Delete that using the keyboard
Sorry you were not able to delete the letter. Try again.
Great job. You correctly deleted a letteer.
Now, try to delete the word Hello in the textfield below.
Great job. You correctly deleted the word. You have completed this module. Sending you back to the lesson screen.
Sorry you were not able to delete the word. Try again.
You have interacted with a menu item. Find the button, then double tap to finish the lesson.

Welcome! We will mainly focus on interact with menu in this lesson. In this module, you will learn how to explore the menu. Usually there are many items in the menu, and you may want to browse them more efficiently. Touching and dragging are used to go through the menu items more quickly. To start, you will explore a two column menu using this method. Touch the screen by your finger and drag it slowly around screen. Make sure your finger is touching the screen at all times. You can drag your finger to any direction, either up, down, right or left. Find the continue button in the menu, double tap it to continue.
Touch the screen with your finger, then drag it slowly around the screen. You can drag your finger in any direction and do not leave the screen. Find the continue button and double tap it.
To finish this module, you will need to find the finish button in the menu items. Once you find the button, double tap to finish the module.
You have interacted with a menu item. Find the button, then double tap to finish the lesson.
You have completed the lesson. Sending you to the main menu.
Welcome. In this lesson, you will learn how to go back to the previous page. To open the next page, double tap to click the continue button.
You have successfully navigated back to the previous page. Lesson complete. Sending you to the main menu.
To navigate back to the previous page, swipe down then left.
gobackModulePart2
stoppedCount

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to return to the home screen from inside an application, to perform this task, swipe up then left. Try it now. But return to the tutorial after you have reached the home screen by swiping left then up to open the recent apps page, then double tapping to return to this app.

Good, you are back, this gesture is useful as it allows you to return to the home screen at anytime no matter where you are. Now do it again, remember the gesture is swipe up then left, return to this app after by swiping left then up to open the recent apps page, then double tapping to return to this app.
Nice, you have navigated back to this screen, you have now learnt how to use the go to home screen gesture. Returning you to the lesson screen now.
The \"Controls\" reading mode allows jumping between buttons, sliders, switches, and other interactive things.
control
controls
header
headers
The \"Headers\" reading mode allows you to jump between headers, such those found before blocks of text or groups of form fields.
link
links
The \"Links\" navigation mode lets you jump between clickable links on a page, such as a URL.
There\'s another %s below. Jump to it.
This is the last %s. Activate it to continue.
To continue, swipe up to the previous %s
That\'s the basics of jumping between %s. Activate to %s.
Switch to the %s reading mode and swipe down to jump to the next %s.
%s
%s
Can you can a canned can into an un-canned can like a canner can can a canned can into an un-canned can?
She sells seashells on the seashore. The shells she sells are seashells, I’m sure. And if she sells seashells on the seashore, Then I’m sure she sells seashore shells.
Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers; A peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked; If Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers, Where’s the peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked
We will now learn to use each reading modes. As you have learned previously, please switch to the reading mode that says \"Paragraph\"

You will now learn to transition between paragraphs. A single swipe up or down will transition between different paragraphs that are on the screen. Please try it until you reach a button that says finish lesson, then double tap to finish the lesson. For your information, this will be a very long practice text so it would be easier to complete it using the Paragraph reading mode. However, you can still try out different reading modes such as Characters, Words and lines reading modes.

You have completed the lesson. To summarise, in this lesson you have learnt to use the Paragraph reading mode to navigate through the page. In the future, you can utilise these different reading modes such as Headers, Controls, Links and more, to navigate through your phone. Sending you back to the Lesson modules.
If you have changed reading mode to Paragraph mode, Please double tap to continue

In this tutorial, you will be learning how to control the media volume sliders and adjust your phone\'s volume. To start, explore your screen by touch and find the play button then double tap to play the music.
Great job! Now, increase the volume of the media above 75 by swiping up.
The song is not played. Please press the play button to play the music.
Talkback is currently not turned on. Please turn Talkback on to continue this lesson
current volume is set above 75. Now that you learned how to increase the volume, we will try decreasing the volume below 25. To decrease the volume, swipe down.
Current volume is set below 25. Congratulations on completing this lesson. Sending you back to the main menu.

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to enable voice commands. To enable voice commands you need to swipe right and then up with one finger. Please perform the gestures and when prompted for a voice command, say help. Listen to the voice command help section and return to the tutorial. You may return to the tutorial by going back.
Well done. Next we will put some voice commands into action.
Now that you know some voice commands, swipe right with one finger to move to the block of text and say, speak faster. This voice command will make talkback speak the text faster.
You have completed this module. Sending you back to the lesson screen.
To make me speak faster swipe right and up with one finger, then say speak faster in a clear voice. Do this gesture and say speak faster three times, then move to the next block of text.
I am now speaking faster. When you have completed listening to this text, swipe right and select the button to finish the module.
Swipe right.
openVoiceCommandPart1

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open your notification panel. Notifications are a way to let you know that something new has happened so you do not miss anything that might be worth your attention and appears whether you are using the application or not. There are two way to do this. First, let us open the notification panel by using 2 finger to swipe from top to the bottom of the screen. Once you opened the notification panel, Talkback will start taking over for a few second. Please wait until Talkback is done then follow the next instruction. Good luck.
Good job. You have opened the notification panel. Now try to close it by doing the same gesture but this time start from the bottom to top"

Well done. The notification panel has been closed. Let\'s try to open it one more time but this time, open it by swiping right, then down immediately. Once again, please wait until Talkback is done then follow the next instruction.
Excellent. Now close it again by swiping from the bottom with 2 fingers

Well done! You now know how to open and check and close your notification panel. Notification panel can also be used to perform many kind of shortcut. For example, connect or disconnect wifi or bluetooth. You have completed the lesson. We will send you back.

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open recent apps. Recent apps are a handy way to quickly switch between frequently used apps. This can be done in two different ways. Firstly, perform a swipe left and then, a swipe up gesture. Please try to perform these gestures one after another, and enter the recent apps menu. Once completed, return to the tutorial.
Great job. You have correctly opened the recent app menu and returned to the tutorial. Now to try with a different method.

Try to open the recent apps menu using the recents button in the bottom right or bottom left corner of your phone. You can double tap this button to open the recent apps menu. If your device does not support a recents button, or you are unsure, perform a swipe left and then, a swipe up gesture again to open the recent apps menu. Then return to the tutorial.
You have completed the open recent apps module. Sending you to the lesson screen.
"openrecentappspart1"

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to open Talkback Menu. Talkback menu let you use commands to read, edit text, control speech output, change Talkback setting, and so on. To do this, perform a swipe up, or, swipe down, and then, a swipe right gesture.
Well done! You now know how to open and close Talkback Menu. Once again, to do this you have to swipe up, or down then swipe right. You have completed the lesson.
Great job. You have opened the Talkback menu. Feel free to navigate around to see what you can do. Once you are done, go to the bottom of the menu and exit.

To scroll down, place two fingers on the screen at the same time, then swipe upwards with both of them. To scroll up, swipe with two fingers in the opposite direction. To finish, find the Continue button at the bottom of this vertical menu, then double tap it to continue.
scrollingModulePart2

Welcome. In this module, you will learn how to scroll through vertical and horizontal menus. Screens often contain very long lists that contain more items than the screen can show at once. Scrolling is used to go through these very long lists of items very quickly. To start, you will try scrolling through a vertical menu with

items. To scroll down, place two fingers on the screen at the same time, then swipe upwards with both of them. To scroll up, swipe with two fingers in the opposite direction. To finish, find the Continue button at the bottom of this vertical menu, then double tap it to continue. You may now start.

To scroll right, swipe left with two fingers. To scroll left, swipe with two fingers in the opposite direction. To finish, first check the checkbox at the end of the horizontal menu, then press the button at the beginning of the horizontal menu.

Now you will learn how to scroll through horizontal menus. When scrolling vertically, you used two fingers to swipe up and down. Now, when scrolling horizontally, you will use two fingers to swipe left and right. To scroll right, swipe left with two fingers. To scroll left, swipe with two fingers in the opposite direction. To finish the lesson, scroll to the end of the horizontal menu, and interact with the button to finish the lesson. You may now start.
You have completed the lesson. Sending you to the main menu.
Great job! You have paused the video. Congratulations on completing this lesson on how to start and stop a video. Sending you to the main menu.

Great job! You have played the video. Now, we will try to pause the video. To pause the video, bring up the media controller and explore by touch to find the pause button. Double tap on the button to pause the video.

In this tutorial, you will be learning how to start and stop a video. To start, double tap your screen to bring up the media controller and find the play button. Double tap to start playing the video.
hello
Great job! You have typed the word hello with the on screen keyboard. Congratulations on completing this lesson. In this lesson you have successfully learnt how to type with the on screen keyboard.
Looks like you have not typed the word hello. Double tap on the screen to bring up the keyboard. Tap on the backspace button to delete the previously typed word and try typing the word hello again.
In this tutorial, you will be learning how to open the on-screen virtual keyboard and type using it. To start, double tap on the screen to open the virtual keyboard.
navigation_bar_height
status_bar_height
dimen
Great job! You opened up the on screen virtual keyboard. Explore by touch to type hello using the keyboard
Well done. You have successfully made a voice recording.
You have successfully played back a recording you made. That\'s all there is right now for working with Simple Voice Recorder. The button below will finish this module.

In this module, you\'ll be doing a few tasks in a modified version of the Simple Voice Recorder app. You can retrieve this modified app from the link below:

resources.string: Your first task will be to make a recording. You\'ll open the app, start recording, and stop. There\'s no need to record any sound.
Open the app
Once you have installed the app, activate the button below to continue.
When you open the app, you should grant it microphone permission. To start recording, press the recording button at the bottom of the main page. The button below will take you to the app.

Billy\'s Toy Shop

An easy-to-handle racket, ideal for intermediate players or young players transitioning from junior to adult size. Made from graphite. Increases the ball contact with the racket by 25 percent, providing more control and comfort. Specifications: Head: 102 sq. in./660 m². Corded: Yes. Cover: Yes. Length: 27 in./685 mm. String Pattern: 16 x 19. Balance: 335 mm. Stiffness: 68 RA. Rim profile: 23mm/26mm/23mm. Weight: 280 grams.
This extra duty tennis ball is ideal for longer play on hard court surfaces. An ideal ball for all levels of tournament and recreational play.
It\'s time to take your game to the next level with this basketball - perfect for beginners as well as professionals.
This fluffy teddy bear will be an ideal sleeptime or playtime companion for your little munchkin.

Each Princess toy shines in a signature colour outfit that sparkles from the top of her bodice to the bottom of her skirt! Little dreamers will love playing out magical moments from Disney Princess movies and imagining their own fairytales with these gorgeous dolls.

A castle that will bring hours of magical play and fun to your little one. It will encourage young children to use their creative thoughts and develop their minds. Decorated with beautiful mushrooms and features a fairy gate that opens and closes. It will help children discover new things about themselves and their world every day.
Kids can engage in hours of fun playtime with this cool, 4x4 climbing car toy.
Enhance your child\'s playtime experince with a touch of artificial intelligence with this cool intelligent robot toy.
Make a magical addition to your child\'s day with this cute unicorn plush.
Kids will have lots of fun playing with this retro-style plastic kitchen set.
Get together with your friends and family this weekend and play exciting card games!
Hop on board for a fun-filled journey through the farm with this wooden train set that will teach your little one various skills.
Delight your little musician with this guitar that is an ideal plaything to indulge in, for interactive, musical fun.
Can I offer you a nice egg in this trying time?

Talkback is disabled. This application requires you to first enable Talkback. Tap \'open settings\' to go to the accessibility settings page, or tap \'exit\' to exit the application.
Talkback is required for this application. You can enable it in the accessibility settings of your device.
Exiting the application.
Opening settings. Return once Talkback is enabled.
Talkback Disabled
Open Settings
Exit
Embedded Video
The Different Memory Storage Areas of the Brain
Saturday 15th July, 2042
Author: Billy Eggman

Within the cerebral cortex, the frontal and temporal lobes are heavily involved in explicit/declarative memory processes. Episodic memories tent to be stored in the frontal lobe (particularly the pre-frontal cortex) and temporal lobe. The same can be assumed with semantic memories. Components of our memories such as visuals and sounds are stored in areas throughout the cerebral cortex. Sound is sotred in the temporal lobe, while visuals in the occipital lobe.

The hippocampus (in temporal lobe) consolidates memories, turning short term memories into long term declarative memories; semantic and episodic. It also has roles in emotional memory due to its proximity to the amygdala, and spatial memory.

The amygdala (in temporal lobe) is involved in emotional memory, and links emotions and emotional responses (such as fear and aggression) to declarative memories. This helps us remember experiences by the emotion we felt during its formation. Also involved in the formation of procedural memories.

The cerebellum is involved in motor learning and the memory of conditioned reflexes. It\'s involved in implicit memory such as procedural memories that require movement. Also has a role in spatial navigation.
Finally, language is stored in Broca\'s area in the left frontal lobe, and memory for pictures are stored in the occipital lobe.

Minigame
Consolidate Learnt Gestures
Welcome. To start or end the minigame, you\'ll need to disable Talkback by holding down both volume keys on the side of your device simultaneously.

Minigame starting. Remember, to exit, hold down both volume keys on the side of your device simultaneously. To play the game, an action will be spoken for you to perform. Perform the correct gesture to score a point. The minigame will start now.
Game ended. Your final score was %1$d. Sending you to the main menu.
Your final score was %1$d. The correct gesture was to %2$s. Setting your score back to 0 and starting a new game.
Current score is %1$d. High score is %2$d
New high score!
Sandbox Mode
Experiment With Gestures
Welcome. To start or end the sandbox, you\'ll need to disable Talkback by holding down both volume keys on the side of your device simultaneously.

Sandbox starting. Remember, to exit, hold down both volume keys on the side of your device simultaneously. To use the sandbox, perform any gesture and the corresponding action will be spoken. The sandbox will start now.
Sandbox ended. Sending you to the main menu.
